author: lsankar
content: PR 2149 doesn't require changes to the beacon chain, so merging it seems decoupled from HF1/HF2/etc.

author: lsankar
content:
It does seem like discussion here (and on the PR) has stalled. i suspect that getting the 0x01 withdrawal cred commitment in the spec is worth doing now with an understanding that withdrawal creds that can trigger withdrawal (i.e. 0x02 option <@!291925846556540928> mentioned above) can be decoupled into a future spec update

does anyone feel differently?

author: djrtwo
content:
Yeah, I was just looking at this again today. Sorry I've gotten general support when reaching out but a few negative feedbacks.

IMO, 0x01 functionality is *very* similar to 0x00 functionality (that is, 0x00 key will have to sign a message specifying an eth1 addr for ultimate withdrawal) so the code paths to support this additional credential are minimal

author: djrtwo
content:
I also think that 80% of interesting usecases can be built out today and the remaining 20% that need more advanced features like reading of beacon chain state (e.g. is validator slashed?) can wait until later development

note, 0x01 can even be used when beacon cahin state can be read with new conditionals in how withdrawn funds are dsitributed

author: djrtwo
content: (obviously can't plan for how beacon state is read today so it would be jsut for future uses)

author: djrtwo
content: as for anything more advanced like eth1 triggering exits and things, we can't reasonably plan for that today so must be deferred

author: lsankar
content: i think there's slight nuance here as 0x01 creds (if they're eth1 addresses) can be interpreted by smart contracts built in eth1 *today*. i.e. don't require a contract in eth1 validating a bls sig

author: djrtwo
content: so 0x01 I think is as good as it gets today and as I mentioned has very similar logic as 0x00 so isn't a terrible increase in legacy support

author: djrtwo
content: yes, of course. there are plenty of things you can do with 0x01's today so I think it's worth it

author: djrtwo
content: I'm just saying, that on beacon chain, there wil probably be a "set withdrawal destination addr" operation that 0x00 creds wil sign

author: lsankar
content: it's the difference b/w being able vs not being able to compose functionality on withdrawal contracts today in eth1

author: djrtwo
content: and once that is done, the withdrawal of 0x00 and 0x01 looks the same

author: djrtwo
content:
I talk about how these two things ultimately are similar here -- https://ethresear.ch/t/simple-eth1-withdrawals-beacon-chain-centric/8256/

similar in that beacon chain logic paths are similar. not in that the practical functionality for users is the same

author: lsankar
content: right

author: djrtwo
content:

author: alon.ssv.network
content: <@291925846556540928> 0x01 is only for newly deposited validators? How would we go about changing existing validators from 0x0 to 0x01? Will that require some changes to the beacon spec?

author: djrtwo
content:
practically, there will be an operation in the future to allow for 0x00 validators to sign a message to specify the destination eth1 address. This could happen either in the beacon chain or when a withdrawal proof is being consumed in eth1 (assuming efficient bls in the EVM). I lean toward beacon chain side, but that doesn't matter too much here.

With the simple release of 0x01, it would not allow for any new functionality for already deployed 0x00 creds today. It would only open up new functionality for newly submitted validators

author: alon.ssv.network
content: Understood. Would you expect being able to change existing validators happen after the merge? Or maybe sooner say in HF1/2?

author: djrtwo
content:
not in HF1.

Merge might be next fork after

The specification of the destination eth1 addr functionality for 0x00  is primarily there for withdrawals so I would assume that is addressed then.
